text: Alexander Mikhailovich Kadakin (; 22 July 1949 - 26 January 2017) was a Russian diplomat. He served as the Russian Ambassador to India twice: from 1999 and 2004, and again from 2009 until his death in 2017. He was also the Russian Ambassador to Nepal (1993-1997) and Sweden (2005-2009). He was born in Chișinău, USSR (now Moldova) to Russian parents. Kadakin died from heart failure on 26 January 2017 in New Delhi. He was 67. ==References== Category:1949 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Ambassadors of Russia Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:People from Chișinău
title: Alexander Kadakin
